definition: vacancy
empty/air/sky/in vain
to empty/vacant/unoccupied/space/leisure/free time
deficiency/lack/scarce/vacant post/to run short of

sentences.english: This inhibited the process of translation, producing a homogeneous population of empty ribosomes.
sentences.chinese: 这抑制了翻译的过程，产生了一个均匀的核糖空缺。

sentences.english: But a focus exclusively on majors and job openings misses two key points.
sentences.chinese: 专门着眼于专业和职位的空缺漏掉了两个关键点。

sentences.english: Shea filled in for Brown at right-back.
sentences.chinese: 奥谢则填补了布朗右边的空缺。

sentences.english: Do you still have openings for the typist？
sentences.chinese: 贵公司还有打字员的空缺吗？

sentences.english: Nor can investment rise to fill the gap.
sentences.chinese: 依靠投资增长来填补空缺也是不可能的。

sentences.english: I'm calling about your job vacancy.
sentences.chinese: 我想咨询一下你们的职位空缺。

sentences.english: A new wave of graduates are scrambling for lots in some companies and factories.
sentences.chinese: 一群刚出校门的毕业生正在公司或工厂中争取空缺。

sentences.english: He legislates only between gaps. He fills the open spaces in the law.
sentences.chinese: 他只是在空白处立法，他填补着法律中的空缺地带。

sentences.english: Todd: There’s vacancy in middle management, you know.
sentences.chinese: 中级管理层有个职位空缺。

sentences.english: Border areas there were numerous vacancies in the lower-level official, the situation required post agenting.
sentences.chinese: 边地存在不少官职空缺，需要职务代理的情况。

sentences.english: But the bond market and loans between companies filled some of the gap.
sentences.chinese: 但是债券市场和公司之间的贷款填补了一些空缺。

sentences.english: Where did you get the job opening information from?
sentences.chinese: 你是在哪里得到的职位空缺的信息呢？

sentences.english: Within two weeks I had filled the remaining vacancies in the cabinet.
sentences.chinese: 两周时间里，我填满了内阁剩下的所有空缺。

sentences.english: G. F. 340 On-line Application System and Government Vacancies Enquiry System Frequently …
sentences.chinese: 网上申请系统及政府职位空缺查询系统。

sentences.english: Guess who fills in the gaps?
sentences.chinese: 你猜谁会填补这些空缺？

sentences.english: Do you still have openings for printer?
sentences.chinese: 你们还有印刷工的空缺吗？

definition: to fill a gap/to fill in a blank (on a form)/to overcome a deficiency
to replace
choice of person/candidate
to replace/to take over (a position or post)
to complement/to make up for a deficiency
to make (some time or space) available (for sb)
post/office/position
to take over (as minister, manager etc)
newly-appointed/newly elected/new (in a political office)
lit. pulling on the lapels exposes the elbows (idiom)/strapped for cash/unable to make ends meet
substitute
to remain in office/to hold on to one's job
to rotate/to take turns/to switch
to take up a post/to start in a new job
to stay behind to take care of things
to substitute/to complement in the proper order/to fill vacancies progressively
